      Creates an list iterator which maps values provided by source using mapper and unmaps values for ListIterator.set(Object) and ListIterator.add(Object) operations using unmapper.

      static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> nextDelegatedSuppliedListIterator(java.util.function.BooleanSupplier hasNext, java.util.function.Supplier<E> supplier)
      Creates a ListIterator which has delegates ListIterator.hasNext() to hasNext function, this iterator also lazy gets element through a supplier and fully supports reverse-iteration, which is implemented using a List.

      • suppliedListIterator

        public static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> suppliedListIterator(int amount,
                                                                 java.util.function.Supplier<E> e)
        Creates a ListIterator which has amount of elements which is supplied by e. Reversed iteration (using ListIterator.hasPrevious() and ListIterator.previous()) are implemented by an array list, and forwarding before backing will returns next element in list. A full supplied is only possible through wrapping a Supplied iterator into a List Iterator
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount of supplied elements
        e - Element supplier.
        Returns:
        Iterator which has amount of elements which is supplied by e.

      • nextDelegatedSuppliedListIterator

        public static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> nextDelegatedSuppliedListIterator(java.util.function.BooleanSupplier hasNext,
                                                                              java.util.function.Supplier<E> supplier)
        Creates a ListIterator which has delegates ListIterator.hasNext() to hasNext function, this iterator also lazy gets element through a supplier and fully supports reverse-iteration, which is implemented using a List. A full supplied is only possible through wrapping a Supplied iterator into a List Iterator, but reverse-iteration is not supported.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        Parameters:
        hasNext - Function to delegate hasNext.
        supplier - Element supplier.
        Returns:
        Iterator which has amount of elements which is supplied by supplier.

      • listIterator

        public static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> listIterator(java.util.Iterator<E> iterator)
        Creates an wrapper which wraps a Iterator into a ListIterator, returned list iterator does not support back-iterating, an back iterating is only possible via .
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        Parameters:
        iterator - Iterator to back.
        Returns:
        Wrapper ListIterator.

      • ofArray

public static <E> java.util.Iterator<E> ofArray(E... args)

        @SafeVarargs
public static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> listIteratorOfArray(E... args)

        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        Parameters:
        args - Elements.
        Returns:
        ListIterator of an array of type E.

      • mapped

        public static <E,Y> java.util.Iterator<Y> mapped(E value,
                                                 java.util.Iterator<E> original,
                                                 java.util.function.Function<E,Y> mapper)
        Creates a iterator to map values. This iterator should only be used in view collections. The behavior is uncertain outside of a view collection.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Input type.
        Y - Output type.
        Parameters:
        value - Original value.
        original - Original iterator.
        mapper - Value mapper.
        Returns:
        Iterator mapping value and delegating remove operations to original iterator.

      • mapped

        public static <E,Y> java.util.ListIterator<Y> mapped(E value,
                                                     java.util.ListIterator<E> original,
                                                     java.util.function.Function<E,Y> mapper,
                                                     java.util.function.Function<Y,E> unmapper)
        Creates a iterator to map values. This iterator should only be used in view collections. The behavior is uncertain outside of a view collection.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Input type.
        Y - Output type.
        Parameters:
        value - Original value.
        original - Original iterator.
        mapper - Value mapper.
        unmapper - Remap value to original type.
        Returns:
        Iterator mapping value and delegating operations to original iterator.

      • mappedIterator

        public static <E,R> java.util.Iterator<R> mappedIterator(java.util.Iterator<E> source,
                                                         java.util.function.Function<E,R> mapper)
        Creates an iterator which maps values provided by source using mapper.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        R - Target type.
        Parameters:
        source - Source iterator.
        mapper - Mapper of values.
        Returns:
        Iterator which maps values of source.

      • mappedIterator

        public static <E,R> java.util.ListIterator<R> mappedIterator(java.util.ListIterator<E> source,
                                                             java.util.function.Function<E,R> mapper,
                                                             java.util.function.Function<R,E> unmapper)
        Creates an list iterator which maps values provided by source using mapper and unmaps values for ListIterator.set(Object) and ListIterator.add(Object) operations using unmapper.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        R - Target type.
        Parameters:
        source - Source iterator.
        mapper - Mapper of values.
        unmapper - Unmapper of values.
        Returns:
        List iterator which maps values of source.

      • addCheckListIterator

        public static <E> java.util.ListIterator<E> addCheckListIterator(java.util.ListIterator<E> listIterator,
                                                                 CRunnable addCheck)
        Wraps a listIterator into another and call addCheck every time ListIterator.add(Object) is called.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Element type.
        Parameters:
        listIterator - List iterator to wrap.
        addCheck - Checker runnable. (Should throw exception if cannot add element).
        Returns:
        Wrapped list iterator.
